definition: to rub/to grind/to polish/to sharpen/to wear down/to die out/to waste time/to pester/to insist
knife/blade/single-edged sword/cutlass/CL:把[ba3]/(slang) dollar (loanword)/classifier for sets of one hundred sheets (of paper)/classifier for knife cuts or stabs
lit. to sharpen one's sword (idiom)/fig. to prepare to attack/to be getting ready for battle
lit. sharpening the axe won't make the wood-splitting take longer (idiom)/fig. time invested in preparations is not lost/a beard well lathered is half shaved
pinyin: mo2 dao1 bu4 wu4 kan3 chai2 gong1

sentences.english: Check out Buck's selection of tapered and pocket sharpeners.
sentences.chinese: 购买巴克精选的锥形磨刀器和口袋磨刀器。

sentences.english: Check out Buck's selection of tapered and pocket sharpeners.
sentences.chinese: 购买巴克精选的锥形磨刀器和口袋磨刀器。

sentences.english: One day he saw a knife sharpener.
sentences.chinese: 一天他看到一个磨刀器。

sentences.english: Quicken work, safety education does not relax.
sentences.chinese: 磨刀不误砍柴功，安全教育不放松。

sentences.english: The finest edge is made with the blunt whetstone. JOHN LYL.
sentences.chinese: 最锐利的锋刃是从粗糙的磨刀石上磨出来的。

sentences.english: They were unbelievably sharp and could be taken apart so they could be washed or the blades sharpened.
sentences.chinese: 剪刀很锋利，两边可以拆开来清洗或是磨刀口。

sentences.english: A knife is sharpened on the grindstone; steel is tempered in fire.
sentences.chinese: 刀在磨刀石上可以磨尖，钢铁是在火中练就的。

sentences.english: Younger sister to smell, like pagans sharpening.
sentences.chinese: 小弟闻姊来，磨刀霍霍向猪羊。

sentences.english: They were unbelievably sharp and could be taken apart so they could be washed or the 10)blades sharpened.
sentences.chinese: 剪刀很锋利，两边可以拆开来清洗或是磨刀口。

sentences.english: If Blondeau sharpened his knife, the monkey sharpened it after him.
sentences.chinese: 如果布朗杜磨刀，猴子随后也会磨刀。

sentences.english: If Blondeau sharpened his knife, the monkey sharpened it after him.
sentences.chinese: 如果布朗杜磨刀，猴子随后也会磨刀。

sentences.english: Easy to sharpen and easy to clean. Your knives are a blessing.
sentences.chinese: 磨刀容易，清理简单，你们的刀真乃厨师之福。

sentences.english: You own your own meat cleaver and sharpen it.
sentences.chinese: 家里有切肉刀和磨刀器。

sentences.english: Sharpening Stones and Weightstones now last 1hour.
sentences.chinese: 磨刀石和平衡石的效果现在持续一小时。

sentences.english: The queen replied that she would apply it to the edges of her soldiers' swords.
sentences.chinese: 玛格丽特回答说，她会用那磨刀石磨利将士剑锋。

sentences.english: I rolled up my shirtsleeves and picked up the razor strop.
sentences.chinese: 我卷起我的衬衫袖子，拿起磨刀皮带。

definition: to rub/to grind/to polish/to sharpen/to wear down/to die out/to waste time/to pester/to insist
a saw/to cut with a saw
contrary/pushing against/bump/knock/used as equivalent for 搶|抢[qiang1]
to quench/to temper/to harden by quenching
